intro: Garnotia longiaristata, commonly known as the slender leaf garnotia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a humid, temperate climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
